attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-LCKLW-tu6xHt55ZexoQ_name
attribs.current: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, heavy crossbow

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCb1LYsHc7aEZSui0ur_description
attribs.current:
Alert to the hidden traps and secret doors found in many dungeons, you gain the following benefits:
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCbEcDp8dLEH1A1bodq_description
attribs.current:
While you came into this unfamiliar world without a copper piece to your name, the advanced knowledge you brought with you has given you something of value to offer. You are well versed in a field that is farther advanced in your original world than the world you are in now. It could be medicine, mathematics, engineering, a craft, or anything else that makes sense for your character.

In order to secure a life for yourself, you contributed this knowledge to some organization that it was relevant to. For example, you might have taught a university the secrets of calculus, or instructed a blacksmith's guild in how to make stronger steel. The organization considers themselves indebted to you for your contribution, and are willing to support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle. They consider you a member of their organization, although you may have to pay monthly dues to gain the full benefits of membership.

The technology you introduced may cause a disruption in the world and its balance of power. Discuss with your DM what impact your knowledge has on the world now that it has been introduced, if any.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: I've left a world at war and found one untouched by the powers that ruined it. Time to start a better life

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Modern war has left me a broken person the only way for me heal is to help others and try and make up for the life i've took

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I want to build a life for myself, here with the people that call this place home

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: as much as i hate it i was trained to be a killer and its one of the few things in life I've been good at.

attribs.name: treasure

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHNwB2c7w7-uPBIVFrW_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Bludgeoning, Range: 20/60

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHNwFyU3F1GIQSZl2UL_itemcontent
attribs.current: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHNwLKOIwZTFGKpZnXR_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Includes:

• a backpack

• a crowbar

• a hammer

• 10 pitons

• 10 torches

• a tinderbox

• 6 days of rations

• a waterskin

• 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHNwUZ8iEqAtZCHEFNO_spelldescription
attribs.current:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHNwfaIWae68cl9dmch_spelltarget
attribs.current: One object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHNwfaIWae68cl9dmch_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A pearl worth at least 100 gp and an owl feather

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHNwfaIWae68cl9dmch_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNwwY8UZcp5tLBO5qE_description
attribs.current: Starting at 2nd level, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses any of the tool proficiencies you gain from this class.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNxRbyGNgwnYpipojj_description
attribs.current:
Your expert craftsmanship allows you to improve your Specialization's Wondrous Item with new attributes.

Starting at 3rd level, choose an upgrade from the list at the end of your specialization. The features and properties of your Specialization's Wondrous Item permanently improves in that way.

You apply an additional upgrade to your Specialization's Wondrous Item at 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 13th, 15th, 17th, and 19th level. You cannot apply an upgrade more than once, unless the upgrade's description says otherwise. Upgrades cannot be replaced or changed, besides as described in the specialization.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNxujjdSJnICG4z5Eh_description
attribs.current: At 6th level, you have mastered the knowledge of using magic to repair things. You learn the mending cantrip, and can cast it at will. Additionally, you learn the cure wounds spell. If you already know cure wounds you can select another spell from the Artificer list. When you cast cure wounds, it can heal constructs in addition to normally valid targets.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LHNy1GEPlLDVG7XmY95_spelltarget
attribs.current: A single break or tear in an object you touch

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LHNy1GEPlLDVG7XmY95_spelldescription
attribs.current:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn clack, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHNy4jJlM9Oka5Ye9HZ_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHNy4jJlM9Oka5Ye9HZ_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNy7TdQQiiznvoSN64_description
attribs.current: At 6th level, your superior understanding of magic items allows you to master their use. You can now attune to up to four, rather than three, magic items at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNyJWcK73WDddvvSCl_description
attribs.current: At 7th level, your familiarity with the workings of magical items means that you can ignore class based restrictions on attuning to magical items.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHNyU9iLd9MnnFVCt0e_itemcontent
attribs.current: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHNyZz3-kr3ZyAtAo85_itemcontent
attribs.current: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNyhXpn8EtgNswgT4A_description
attribs.current:
When you choose this specialization at 1st level, you gain proficiency with jeweler's tools and calligrapher's supplies.

Your knowledge of infusion magic gives you a natural affinity for scribing spell scrolls. Creating a magic spell scroll only takes you half the time and material cost it would normally take.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNz5KqTU-1lfoVEo0H_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 1st level, you can infuse your weapon with a powerful magic. As a bonus action, you can infuse a weapon you are holding, causing it to burst into ethereal flames.

The first time you hit an attack with that weapon before the end of your next turn, it deals an additional 1d6 force damage, and the infusion ends.

This damage increases by 1d6 at 5th level Artificer (2d6), and again at 11th level (3d6) and 17th level (4d6).

When attacking with an infused weapon, you can use you Intelligence modifier in place of your strength or dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNzC51RIAtXriCvBKY_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to channel your artificer spells into a non-magical item for later use.

At the end of a short or long rest, pick a spell you know. You can infuse this spell into an item for later use. You must expend any components the spell requires, but this does not expend a spell slot. Subsequently, any creature holding the item with an Intelligence of 6 or higher that is aware there is magic infused in it can expend the stored magic and cast the spell.

The spell uses your spellcasting modifiers, but is in all other ways treated as if the creature holding it cast the spell. The magic infused in the item fades if you complete a short or long rest without expending the stored spell.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHNzc6Zw9l80jISujX7_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 5th level, you can animate a weapon to strike your enemies. At the end of a long rest, you can touch a non-magical melee weapon and bring infuse it with animating magic. You do not need to have proficiency with this weapon. During this time, when you take the attack action, you can mentally direct the animated weapon to attack a creature within within 30 feet of you.
The weapon returns to your side after every attack. If there is no path between you and the target of your attack, the attack fails, but the animated weapon otherwise ignores cover.

When attacking with an animated weapon, it is treated as if you had proficiency in the weapon (whether you do or not) and you can use you Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHO-mBSVvShvKaiFzZm_description
attribs.current: You learn mastery of armoring yourself with magical enchantments. You learn the mage armor spell and cast it at will. While under the effect of mage armor, you can add your Intelligence to your armor class instead of your dexterity.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHO0HTyZvQfg5YDBqYK_description
attribs.current:
You set up a special magical bond between you and another creature. When either creature bound by this abilities fails Wisdom, Intelligence or Charisma saving throw, the other character can make their own saving throw, replacing the failed saved with their own roll. If this ability is used on a death saving throw, the replacement roll is a 20. Once a roll is replaced by this feature, it cannot be used again until both creatures in the bond have completed a short or long rest.

This bond can be set up with a different creature at the end of a long rest

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHO1MDlLsHEP7Zk6O22_description
attribs.current:
You refine techniques of magical enhancements for weapons to be easier to use and maintain. You learn the spell magical weapon, and at 9th level you learn the spell elemental weapon. These do not count against your known spells, and if you already know them you may select a different Artificer spell to learn.

When you cast magical weapon or elemental weapon, you can target a weapon that is already magical, adding to any effect the weapon already has. Additionally, when you have to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, you do so with advantage.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHO1XaYIz5uC5xEFccx_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, that weapon becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHO1XaYIz5uC5xEFccx_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHO2iIH5U7HehxtBl9o_itemcontent
attribs.current: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHO2js7JUhuyUqg7WKV_itemcontent
attribs.current: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any Ability Checks you make to Identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create Antitoxin and potions of healing.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHO2lk3VJikh4yREObx_itemcontent
attribs.current: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHO4n8xOP6R6fNCy4s3_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Range: 20/60,Secondary Damage: 2d6

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO51QHGz1STHycQsnH_spellcastingtime
attribs.current: 1 reaction, which you take when you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO51QHGz1STHycQsnH_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to five falling creatures within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO51QHGz1STHycQsnH_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A small feather or piece of down

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO51QHGz1STHycQsnH_spelldescription
attribs.current: Reaction - When you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the spell ends for that creature.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO5HDZKFgb5mjbLSAy_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A pinch of soot and salt

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO5HDZKFgb5mjbLSAy_spelldescription
attribs.current:
For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text.

This spell doesn’t decode secret messages in a text or a glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn’t part of a written language.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO5PY0yZQudXrGqEek_spelltarget
attribs.current: A 10-foot square centered on a point within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO5PY0yZQudXrGqEek_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A bit of pork rind or butter

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHO5PY0yZQudXrGqEek_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHO5mkldYP19vV8c-nI_spelldescription
attribs.current: The target must succeed on a Strength save or its flying speed is reduced to 0 feet for the spell's duration. An airborne creature safely descends at 60 feet per round until it reaches the ground or the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHO6RJ19W5HxYvLFR1f_spelltarget
attribs.current: A humanoid that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHO6RJ19W5HxYvLFR1f_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A small, straight piece of iron

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHO6RJ19W5HxYvLFR1f_spelldescription
attribs.current: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHO6RJ19W5HxYvLFR1f_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target on additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHO87ZjeyOKSuVGhIuv_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d12, Damage Type: Slashing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHO88sqI4Jm6ulbabsE_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 2d6, Damage Type: Bludgeoning

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHOApyuBr7horVfP4UY_spelltarget
attribs.current: A willing creature who isn't wearing armor

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHOApyuBr7horVfP4UY_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends it if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHOC1SrULKqtkATVGgz_itemcontent
attribs.current: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHUNJnqbDwraFWFx01L_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHUNJnqbDwraFWFx01L_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see in the dark. For the duration, that creature has darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHUSBKDGImaZpBDKrcl_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHUSBKDGImaZpBDKrcl_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Bludgeoning, Secondary Damage: 1d8, Melee Attacks +1, Melee Damage +1

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHUmWdJIFPfpznrr38q_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHUmWdJIFPfpznrr38q_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Bludgeoning, Secondary Damage: 1d8, Melee Attacks +1, Melee Damage +1

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHd-qXmtdTWATpiZvbN_description
attribs.current: Once a spell caster hits level 8 they receive this feat automatically. This feat allows for two spells to be cast per turn(one for an action, one for a bonus action) as long as one is 2nd level or lower. This does not change the Casting Time of spells in anyway, it allows for another spell of 2nd level or lower to be cast

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJUA-NDs-jVPaqoG-Ze_itemcontent
attribs.current:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJUA-NDs-jVPaqoG-Ze_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320, Ranged Attacks +1, Ranged Damage +1

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJUBNkU2sSRxmnkQ73w_itemcontent
attribs.current:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJUBNkU2sSRxmnkQ73w_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320, Ranged Attacks +1, Ranged Damage +1
